result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Markus J. Dejong

records.addlTxt: Amended: (cash already posted) Markus Dejong shall have no physical contact with N.D., nor cause any other party to have physical contact with N.D. Contact may be made, however, through use of text messaging as long as the topics pertain to the DeJong Dairy business or their minor child, B.J.D.; Any previous bond conditions pertaining to the limitations of accessing DeJong Dairy are removed. Markus can access the Dairy through any road, and may enjoy use of all grounds on the property without limitation. Markus is allowed to enter the residence at 3398 Draper Road, Dorchester, WI, 54425, as N.D. no longer resides or works at that location. N.D. shall have the right to access the parties' real estate solely for child placement exchanges and for the purposes of visually inspecting the parties' business operations at the real estate at reasonable times and upon reasonable notice. N.D. shall not intentionally cause contact with Markus DeJong at the Dejong Family Diary property. Absolute sobriety.
Re: Stipulation and Order Amending Bond Conditions
Calendar call on November 3, 2022 at 01:00 pm.
Calendar call on October 20, 2022 at 01:00 pm.

Clerk: Kassidi.
State appears by ADA Cody Marschall in person. Defendant appears in person and with Atty Trevor Peterson in person.
VRCW.
Parties are still actively discussing resolution.
DATES: Future dates to be left on at this time.
Adjourned: 2:17 pm

ADA Cody Marschall appears in person; Atty Peterson appears in person
DATES CONTINUED

Marathon County Victim Waiver of No Contact bond Condition- N.D. (conditional). Victim will allow Defendant to enter the dairy through 3380 Draper Road, going that way will allow him to get to the dairy. Defendant not to go anywhere past the pool on the main lawn. Defendant may access the scale house. N.D. will allow Defendant to contact them via text message only for the purposes of their minor child BJD and for business related to Dejong Family Dairy only.

Clerk: Amanda;
Case Called 2:26 pm:

State appears by ADA Kyle Mayo; Deft appears in person with Atty Peterson;
Date and time set for IA and warrant quashes; VRCW.

COURT QUASHES WARRANTS.

Reading Waived. Reserve Jurisdiction.
Court questions deft re: complaint and rights.
Advised Right of Counsel.

PLEA: NOT GUILTY.

COURT ORDERS: $350 cash bond to be continued - CONDITIONS:
- No contact with NND
- Absolute sobriety.
- Marathon County deputy escort for property.

No contact with victim(s):  NND.
